title: Heya! The Hanshmear here — Content Editor for Riot OCE — Ask Me Anything!
body:
_EDIT: Thanks for the comments all! It's been rad to chat, I'll hopefully catch some of you on the Rift!_

[Hey! Listen!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WaNJzox-QNA)

Alex "The Hanshmear" Saccardo's the name, I've been with Riot for about half a year, playing with grammar and working on mid lane. My jam is words, so I'm in charge of the content that goes through the client and [oce.leagueoflegends.com](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/), oh, and some of the content you'll find on [oce.lolesports.com](http://oce.lolesports.com/) too.

I'm a sucker for story—[Ocean Week](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/oceanweek-2017/recap) and [Skins Story Slam](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/contest-fan-fiction/GWZ8anEO-skins-story-slam-fanfiction-contest) probably give this away—a love that spans all mediums: novels, comics, films, books, games, music; if there's a storytelling aspect, [I'M INTO IT](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zMicOuO_Azw)!

Before Riot I lived a freelance life: a hectic mix of everything and anything online and print based. The best times were writing think pieces about the state of gaming, the worst times were reviewing mediocre games that just. kept. going. 

My favourite games are legion, but a few notables are Chrono Trigger (I revisit the soundtrack daily \m/), Last of Us, Dark Souls, Terranigma, Journey, Left 4 Dead 2, FTL, League & Fire Emblem. There are always more, but recently I've had a rad time with Horizon Zero Dawn, Hyper Light Drifter and Firewatch. 

I also like playing guitar, camping, coffee (I'm from Melbourne, it's built into MY SOUL!), dogs AND cats, and one time I jumped so high I high-fived the moon*.

I'm rambling. Tell me a cool story! Or ask me anything!

*Can't verify

will graves have his cigar on oce? if not, why?
I honestly don't know at this stage, but I damn well hope so.
ikr
Not sure if you've read all of the champions lores but if so which one is your favourite? Or, well, which champion lore is your favourite anyway?

I love Kindred! The duality of death—and those that choose to fight/accept it—is so intriguing to me. I also really dig Kled, the tough as nails, never say die fighter who rides a cowardly mount has potential for some excellent stories or, at the very least, a really fun D&D character. 

A fanfic story from the Skins Story Slam by Saben about [Dreadnova Gangplank](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/contest-fan-fiction/8mTzb4NJ-sss-finalist-the-dreadstar) made me put him right up there too. His reaction as he's about to get sucked into the void is just so damn great.

How about you?

Considering that she is my favourite champ of the game and how her lore got updated too, it definitely has to be Quinn. I just love her lore, story, everything about her. I wondered at first about her changed lore but since it kept most of the elements of her old lore and introduced a whole lot more I was super happy about it :)

When I first started with League I loved playing Quinn adc alongside a Blitz sup. She was the first character I really felt comfortable with. I love her slightly slumped posture and the way she moves: it's a bit dorky (her dance too) and quite different to most of the "cool" champs.
Yeah haha. She wouldn't seem like the type of person to boast over anything regardless of what it was. There are times where I do miss her old ult but her new ult is pretty cool too

Random guy but my favourites are probably new Lux because she just says "No" to the rules, Taric because it shows he's not just a pushover beauty guy and Sion because he has none. He just kills (Krombopulos Michael)

My brother currently mains Taric support and is so fabulous in the role, a real rock that the team can rely on, and I've been on Lux of late so I have to agree with you! A magic user in an anti-magic world has the same kind of duality spoken as the chars above.
Do you prefer the rooster or the chicken?

When I was young, I became m8s with a lil lamb and told my mum I never wanted to eat lamb again. She had to feed a family of five, and wasn't about to cook an extra meal for her young son who was trying to develop a very selective conscience. 

So, crafty ol' mammy decided she'd still cook lamb, but simply tell me every meat was chicken. Beef became 'nice chicken' and lamb became 'delicious chicken'. When all meats are chicken, how can you not love the damn thing?

So yeah, chicken. Ain't got no stories about roosters. 

I still get teased by the fam for all those years of asking "what's this chicken?" though...
Have you ever played a game when you were younger and cringed at it now?

ALL THE TIME. 

Bubsy Bobcat for one. Another would be Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II. The game was so much fun, but I thought the cut scenes were SO COOL back then. Looking back.... not so much. 

No regrets though.

Kyle Katarn and Mara Jade may have been removed from the extended universe, but they'll live forever in my heart.

Hey! Bubsy isn't that bad! 

It's not just because I get the most joy in life from inflicting horrible puns on people. I promise.
It all suddenly makes so much sense.
What is your favourite genre for stories?

Fantasy and gothic lit are generally my bag. I love epic adventures and tragic heroes, soaring landscapes and unknown evils that lurk to the left of our understanding. 
 
How about you Zookie? Your SSS entry was such a joy to read, I'd be keen to know what influences your writing. I'm always looking to read/play/watch/listen outside my comfort zone.

Fantasy is absolutely my jam. The idea of creating amazing worlds has always won me over and I especially love the interesting systems of magic that different authors come up with! 

Aside from that, I've always loved any novel or story that is written by an author with a great mastery of language. I love the poetic phrases by Patrick Rothfuss, the use of slang in A Clockwork Orange and the humorous lines in Good Omens.
I'm glad you mentioned Rothfuss! I love how detailed and almost scientific the study of magic is in that series. The third book can't come quick enough, really.

Tell me about it! I love losing myself in his writing. The opening few paragraphs of my SSS story was directly inspired by the way he opens and ends each of his novels talking about a silence of three parts. I love the imagery of it.

New question, has there ever been an idea or concept that you've wanted to do really badly, but you know that it's just never going to be feasible? ( Perhaps a bad concept that would never sell, but entertain you a lot, or something that requires more production value than you have access to )

Always! there are so many, but I'll just unleash one. I want to start a series of magazines called 'Gamer Obscura' that follows the evolution of gaming and film alongside each other, comparing similarities and differences, with big features on key developers, systems, hardware titles etc as it goes through the ages. This has never happened, and print is having a really hard time right now, but you never know, maybe someday!

How about you? What's something you'd like to achieve Jason? Judging how your FanFic entry evolved into a rad video, I imagine you'd have some ace ideas up your sleeve...

Several, but I'm happy to share.

I have a LoL Machinima series that I've written and have been waiting for the chance to actually go along with it, but it requires some filming in real life and on location, so it's been put on the backburner. The very VERY basic idea is that a real player finds himself able to communicate and talk with A.I. ( bots ) and decides to try and make videos for MyView ( noname youtube ). What starts as a pretty slapstick machinima comedy between a player, and some very basic bots, ends up becoming rather complex and sinister.

I also have a movie script that I've rewritten a few times now, and while I don't think I'll ever be in a position where I can pitch a movie idea, I know that it'd be a damn decent movie.
What are the main things you change with the OCE page compared to the other regions?

The amount of League-based content that comes from devs and content creators for all regions is quite large at the moment. With different sections like Ask Riot, /dev, champ updates and skin release flooding the site, we've been focusing on pushing things that are more relatable to oce. 

Lately, we've been really trying to give visibility to community content: fanfic and art, high school and uni events. We've also really thrown a lot of time into the opl this year, as we really believe in the league and want to provide you guys with as much content surrounding the goings on as possible! 

The biggest thing that differs our publishing calendar to other regions' cals is Ocean Week though. I'd love to offer more events of this ilk, or oce focused guides, going forward. 

Anything you'd like to see?

Nothing immediately comes to mind, keep up the good work.

Another question, if you had to describe OCE in a picture or words, how would you describe it? What do you associate with OCE? Personally, I associate OCE with water and islands, champions like {{champion:267}} {{champion:105}} and water themed skins come to mind.

Edit: Oooh you could show me the way of words and write a short story about OCE

Oceania's like an ocean with a heart. It's amazing to see how passionate our slice of the world is. In OPL the 'Fighto' mentality of Sin Gaming shows our gusto, in Ocean Week the sheer amount of games the Homeguards put in to defeat each monster shows our dedication, and the fact that y'all are round on the boards chatting about League shows our passion. It's a cool community to be part of, that's for sure!
Have you ever found a blatant league copy? As in same characters different names and looks. And if so what did you do about it if you did anything?

Heya! Across all media/business there's so much replication. It sucks when someone is doing something unique and another person comes to cash in on it, but at the same time it keeps things competitive and, more importantly, moving forward. If first person shooters stopped at Wolfenstein, then we'd never have Doom. If they then stopped at Doom, we'd never have Half Life, or Halo or Borderlands etc. The theory here is, if you're doing something excellent, then players will keep helping you do that excellent thing. The best thing that you can do is ensure that you're delivering the best product you possibly can for people who actually want it. 

What I love about League is that it's constantly evolving. The game is insanely different to what it was in 2009, and that's largely due to such a passionate community that's so vocal around what they like, what they don't like and how to improve it. A blatant League copy isn't a reason to get angry/scared, it's a challenge, and a good reason to avoid complacency. 

A day may come where a League clone eats us alive and if it does, so be it. If that game is able to give players more than we can, it means we've failed, so all the best to them. But in the words of my favourite King of Gondor, it is not this day!

HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO CHOOOOOOOSE!???????

Hopefully we can all be mature adults about this one.

I personally believe that what this game lacks is an accurate enough ranking system because the current one being heavily determined by 4 other random players on your team every game just doesn't give me the opportunity to control my own rank, and I have been working for 5+ years to play professionally, currently I have the best stats in the world relative to twitch mains (by no small margin either).

I cannot convince anyone that the system is far too inaccurate with facts and despite delivering an acceptable although untested alternative which I offered to also help refine, it was turned down. I find myself unable to follow my passion and dream, and yet it seems to be the only thing within reach in the near future yet not within realistic control.

How would you go about dealing with or working with this dilemma, or do you have anything you would like to add?

Heya WhitePumah!

This is a hard one. At its core, League is a team game, so it makes sense that the team element plays a large role in the outcome of each game. For context—ranked climbing is definitely not my speciality as I'm livin' in Bonze at the moment—but with that said, here's my two cents. Playing with strangers can be hard sometimes, but it can also be amazingly rewarding too. If you're finding that teammates are dropping the ball on occasion and hindering you from getting you where you need to go, have you tried pulling a posse together of players you trust to head in on ranked? Given the nature of the beast, it's important to recognise that League will always be about 5 members, not 1, and the more you're aware of this, the more you can do to make that work in your favour. The system's not perfect, and it sucks it's causing you grief, but keep at it!

Out of interest, what's your alternative?  I'd be keen to hear what changes you'd like to see here.
Ebon Hawk or Millennium Falcon?
Serenity.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Get out...
Haha fair. I'd stay traditional with the Falcon for nostalgia's sake - but KotoR definitely has a place in my heart.
